data.event: Las Vegas was established in 1835 after a group of settlers received a land grant from the Mexican government.
During the Mexican-American War in 1846, Stephen W. Kearny delivered an address at the Plaza of Las Vegas claiming New Mexico for the United States.

event.title: 1877 Las Vegas College, the precursor to Regis University, was founded

data.event: In 1877 Las Vegas College, the precursor to Regis University, was founded in Las Vegas by a group of exiled Italian Jesuits.
In 1887, Las Vegas College moved to Denver whereupon the name was changed.
